metadata.title: CVE-2016-10254 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.description:
The allocate_elf function in common.h in elfutils before 0.168 allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted ELFfile, which triggers a memory allocation failure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10254` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

elfutils - 0.168-0.2
libasm1 - 0.168-0.2
libdw1 - 0.168-0.2
libelf1 - 0.168-0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: elfutils package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.168-0.2').
